com.barryholroyd.prodlisthpdemo.cache_memory

Class CacheMemoryImage

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.barryholroyd.prodlisthpdemo.cache_memory.CacheMemoryBlob<java.lang.String,android.graphics.Bitmap>
      • com.barryholroyd.prodlisthpdemo.cache_memory.CacheMemoryImage

  • public class CacheMemoryImage
extends CacheMemoryBlob<java.lang.String,android.graphics.Bitmap>
    Memory cache system extending CacheMemoryBlob to be specific to a String (url) for the key and a Bitmap for the blob. sizeOf() is overridden so that we can specify the maximum amount of storage allocated using bytes for the unit size.

    Static factory methods are used to create new instances so that the maximum cache size can be specified in either bytes or percentage of the total available memory (if implemented using constructors, the constructors would have the same signature and hence be indistinguishable).

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class com.barryholroyd.prodlisthpdemo.cache_memory.CacheMemoryBlob

        currentCacheSize, maxCacheSize

    • Method Detail

      • createWithPercent

        public static CacheMemoryImage createWithPercent(int percent)
        Set the cache size as a percentage of overall maximum memory.

        If you do this, you'll need to override sizeOf() also.

        Parameters:
        percent - percentage of the available memory to use for the memory cache.

      • createWithBytes

        public static CacheMemoryImage createWithBytes(long maxCacheSize)
        Set the maximum cache size in bytes.
        Parameters:
        maxCacheSize - maximum cache size in bytes

      • sizeOf

        protected long sizeOf(java.lang.String key,
                      android.graphics.Bitmap bm)
        Return the size of a specific cached item instance.
        Overrides:
        sizeOf in class CacheMemoryBlob<java.lang.String,android.graphics.Bitmap>
        Parameters:
        key - the key for the bitmap being stored.
        bm - the bitmap being stored.
        Returns:
        the size of the bitmap being stored.
